byline.contributor: John Schwartz and Michael Wines contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A United States Geological Survey report identifies 17 regions with significant levels of “induced seismicity,” mostly from oil and gas drilling. The two worst hit areas are centered in Oklahoma.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Maps Pinpoint Earthquakes Linked to Quest for Oil and Gas
headline.main: U.S. Maps Pinpoint Earthquakes Linked to Quest for Oil and Gas

snippet: A United States Geological Survey report identifies 17 regions with significant levels of “induced seismicity,” mostly from oil and gas drilling. The two worst hit areas are centered in Oklahoma.
abstract: United States Geological Survey identifies 17 regions across United States where thousands of earthquakes have been linked to oil and gas drilling; comprehensive assessment presents strongest evidence yet of risks posed by wastewater disposal from hydraulic fracturing, showing that earthquakes have become hundreds of times more common than only a few years earlier; two worst-hit areas are in Oklahoma.
